oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The development and potential of the biological insecticide granulovirus on codling moth
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Horgan, A R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Fruit and berries
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cydia pomonella granulovirus is being developed for the UK market and offers opportunities for orchard growers to develop reduced pesticide residue programmes when targeting codling moth control.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Horgan, A R (2006) The development and potential of the biological insecticide granulovirus on codling moth. In: Atkinson, C; Ball, B; Davies, D H K; Rees, R; Russell, G; Stockdale, E A; Watson, C A; Walker, R and Younie, D (Eds.) Aspects of Applied Biology 79, What will organic farming deliver? COR 2006, Association of Applied Biologists, pp. 227-228.
